content: Perfect!

Really shocked and unhappy that this app sends your recordings off to a cloud service for transcoding (this happened when I tried to open a .M4A file). Some warning before doing that would have been nice. Otherwise it did what I hoped, I would just prefer to prevent unnecessary data leakage.

After some hesitation (.ogg wont open?), I decided to give a 5 star rating, because the app is suporting my productivity so well. I am using it for work, editing several hours of speech files. I have tried many apps previously, this is the best by far.

I'm experiencing an issue that I have not been able to solve. I purchased the Master Version hoping that it would just a glitch with the Free app, but it's still happening. When I start a recording, audio levels are fine and the file continues to record sound as normal. However, when my screensaver comes on the sound mutes and no audio can be heard, but the recording is still going. When I unlock my phone, sound is picked up again. I have tried troubleshooting the problem by turning off all battery optimization and any settings that might restrict the app's background activity. I have also adjusted the screensaver time to see if the problem still happens, which it does. The audio seems to mute approximately 1 minute after the screensaver has come on, but resumes immediately upon unlocking my phone. This basically makes the app useless if I cannot record with my screen off. Why is this happening?
replyContent:
Hi Ashley, We have escalated this issue to our Development Team and they are taking a closer look.Can you please tell us what device you are currently using? content: I mostly do trimming and normalising on my recordings, which works as it should. I tried compressing and equalising but the way they are implemented makes them unusable for serious editing. WavePad generates a preview each time a change is made to the effect. This preview generation takes quite a while, nearly 25 seconds on my Galaxy Tab S for a 3 minutes recording - so imagine on tablets with less powerfull processors! I would still accept this if WP would offer the possibility to easily compare the result of the preview to the original recording. But no, it's all trial and error.  WP doesn't allow to read files from SD card. This could lead to storage problems because WP creates a working copy in its own dedicated folder thus duplicating the amount of storage space used for each file.  WP allows to save recordings as MP3, but why only in 64kbps and 128kbps quality?  My verdict: although WavePad is packed with interesting features, the way they are implemented makes them mostly useless for serious sound file editing. That makes its price tag way too high! The free version would have been fine for me if it hadn't a limitation in using effects.
replyContent:
Hello, We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. I'll pass your comments on to our Development Team so we can work on improving the app. Thanks again!
- NCH Software
